main event: A civilian observed a silver, ballistic missile-shaped object traveling northwest, then making a 90-degree right turn and continuing in level flight until it was no longer visible.
interesting points: The object was first observed approximately 30 degrees above the horizon and appeared to be traveling northwest.
After the initial sighting, the object seemed to descend slightly and assume a level flight attitude, then made a 90-degree right turn and continued in level flight until no longer in view.
The object was visible for approximately one minute.
A T-33 aircraft approaching Langley AFB at approximately the same time and altitude was determined to be the likely cause of the sighting.
The investigator noted that from a similar angle and lighting conditions, a T-33 aircraft can appear to have the shape of a larger object, creating an optical illusion.
result: The object was determined to be a T-33 aircraft approaching Langley AFB.
